entry.title: Position To Job Sync through Data Loader API creating blank Job Relationship record
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently facing a setback in SuccessFactors Employee Central with an API transaction in Job Information.

Scenario:  DATA Loader is being used to update Job Information for employees. While doing a Job information update for an employee (let's say we create a blank data change record in the Job Information with today's date).  After uploading, a blank record gets created in Job Information with Data Change as event reason (AS EXPECTED), but a blank Job relationship record is also getting created with the same effective date.
As per rule trace, the Position to Job Sync rule is getting triggered and e due to the different "Set" Job Relationship Matrix rules, Job Relationship portlet is getting affected and creating blank records even if there no change in Position Matrix relationships.

Is there any workaround where the API profile can be made to identify that this data loader update will only trigger Job Information and not Job Relationship if there is no change in Matrix relationships?

Thanks,
Rigjit Banerjee

entry.title: Automating Job Information Updates with Position Synchronization in SAP SF Employee Central
entry.content:
Agenda

  1. Why Job Info → Position sunchornization matters
  2. Step-by-step configuration with Business Rules
  3. Role of Event Reasons
  4. Best practices to avoid errors
  5. Final thoughts

Why Should Position and Job Info Be Synced?

  • In SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, both Position and Job Information Portlets often hold overlapping data → like Department, Location, or Division. When these don’t match, confusion and manual errors occur.
  • By enabling Job Info-to-Position Synchronization , we allow Automatic Population of updated values from the position object into the employee’s job information portlet. It saves time and avoids discrepancies
  • Position and job information portlet Both should Match. Usually positions have tendency to Synchronize data to job information portlet. That means if you get 1 new update in position then those information can be automatically populated from Position job information portlet Info Via position to Job information Synchronization.
  • If you have different information on employee profile i .e job information portlet and on a position, how can you recognize the correct information?
  • So, You need to synced both Position and job information portlet data to avoid mismatch inofrmation to reduced the inconsistencey in the data. If you are not using Synchronization then you're losing automation as the data from the position is not matched with Job Information portlet.
  • In configuration using position management, only use Position-to-Job Info synchronization most commonly used the other Synchronization is a  little bit tricky and is not as much straight forward as this Positio-To-Job Information. I strongly recommend you to use Position to Job Information Synchronization in Manage Position management settings to reduce this data redundancy.

Why positions and job info must match in Successfactors Employee Central?

Position and Job Info Both should Match. Usually positions have tendency to sync data to job info. That means if you get 1 new update in position then those information can be automatically populated from Position Job Info Via position to Job Info Synchronization.

Why Job Info and Position must match in Successfactors Employee Central?

  • If you have different information on employee profile and on a position, how can you recognize the correct information?
  • So, You need to sync both to avoid mismatch info. If you are not using sync then you're losing automation as the data from the position.
  • In configuration using position management, only use Position-to-Job Info synchronization direction. I strongly recommend you to use Position to Job info Sync in Manage Position management settings to reduce the User error.

How Synchronization works:

  • Go to "Position Management Settings".
  • Navigate to the "Synchronization Tab".
    • The "Synchronization Tab" determines the behavior of the system when synchronizing data from a Position to an employee’s Job Information. This includes the rules for defining fields used in synchronization of Position to an employee’s Job Information.
  • Configure the fields that should sync
  • Add Business Rules for triggering updates (e.g., when a position is changed, reflect changes in Job Info).

Step-by-Step: Position to JobInfo Sync Configuration with Business Rule:

Define the Use Case:

  • When a change happens in the Job Information Portlet  (like Department, Division, Location), it should automatically reflect in the Position Object.
  • This is handled via a Business Rule using the Scenario: Synchronize Incumbent’s Changes to Position Scenario.

Step: 1 - Create the Business Rule:

  1. Go to Configure Business Rules.

  2. Click Create New Rule.

  3. Choose Position Management  - Pre Delivered Template. 

  4. Under Scenario, select: Synchronize Incumbent’s Changes to Position Scenario.

Step: 1 Create the business Rule

Step 2 - Register the Rule in Position Management Settings:

  1. Go to Admin Center → Position Management Settings.

  2. Navigate to the Synchronization Tab.

  3. Find the field: "Rule for Synchronizing Job Information to Position".

  4. Assign the Business Rule you just created (JobToPos)

  5. Save the configuration.

Step: 3 Event Reason object configuration

  • Event Reasons act as triggers for synchronization.
  • Common examples:
    • Position Transfer → when an employee moves to a new role.
      • If you are going to change the position then position transfer will be use as follow up activity.
    • Position Reclassification → when department/division updates occur.
      • If you want to change in department and Division then Position Reclassification will be use as follow up activity.
  • These objects ensure accurate, event-driven updates.
  • For the Job info to position Synchronization we need to get help from event reason. On the base of event reason we will get change. Mainly we creates three objects event reason to change happen from Job info to position.

Step: 4 job information portlet and create Business Rule

Prerequisite:

  • First you need to go to Job Information Portlet and check here if we have Event and Event Reason Picklist field is enabled or not.
  • If its enabled and will be visible there then we don’t need to write the business rule for this case user will select manually.
  • If its not enabled then event and event reason will not come up here so we have write the business rule.

Ensure Sync Triggers on Job Info Changes:

  • Also make sure:

    • If the Job Information field is edited within Position Object, this rule should still trigger.

    • Use Position Code as a field in Job Information portlet.

    • Validate permissions and ensure the employee is tied to a valid position.

Pro-tips for error reduction and automation:

  • Use only the direction JobInfo → Position Synchronization.
  • Avoid two-way Synchronization i.e. Position → JobInfo Synchronization & JobInfo → Position Synchronization. to reduce data loops and overwrites.
  • "If you're not syncing the data then there is mandatory inconsistency between both Position & Job Information Portlet, you're missing automation."
  • Test in Preview or Staging before deploying to Production.
  • Clearly document synced fields to reduce confusion.

Final Thoughts on Job Information → Position Synchronization:

Synchronizing between Job Information portlet to Position is not just a technical configuration—it's a strategic step toward ensuring data integrity, process automation, and organizational consistency.

By automating this Synchronization:

  • You eliminate manual data entry and human errors.

  • Keep employee records aligned with organizational structures.

  • Enable clean, audit-ready data for downstream processes like reporting, payroll, and workflows.

When configured correctly using business rules and one-way sync, it transforms how your HR operations function—bringing accuracy, efficiency, and confidence to every transaction.

Regards,

Mahnoor Naseem

SAP SuccessFactors Consultant

  • Avoid two-way Synchronization i.e. Position → JobInfo Synchronization & JobInfo → Position Synchronization. to reduce data loops and overwrites.
  • "If you're not syncing the data then there is mandatory inconsistency between both Position & Job Information Portlet, you're missing automation."
  • Test in Preview or Staging before deploying to Production.
  • Clearly document synced fields to reduce confusion.

Final Thoughts on Job Information → Position Synchronization:

Synchronizing between Job Information portlet to Position is not just a technical configuration—it's a strategic step toward ensuring data integrity, process automation, and organizational consistency.

By automating this Synchronization:

  • You eliminate manual data entry and human errors.

  • Keep employee records aligned with organizational structures.

  • Enable clean, audit-ready data for downstream processes like reporting, payroll, and workflows.

When configured correctly using business rules and one-way sync, it transforms how your HR operations function—bringing accuracy, efficiency, and confidence to every transaction.

Regards,

Mahnoor Naseem

SAP SuccessFactors Consultant

entry.title: Keeping Positions in Sync with Job Info Portlet in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
entry.content:
Agenda

  1. Why Job Info → Position sunchornization matters
  2. Step-by-step configuration with Business Rules
  3. Role of Event Reasons
  4. Best practices to avoid errors
  5. Final thoughts

Why positions and job info must match in Successfactors Employee Central?

Position and Job Info Both should Match. Usually positions have tendency to sync data to job info. That means if you get 1 new update in position then those information can be automatically populated from Position Job Info Via position to Job Info Synchronization.

Why Job Info and Position must match in Successfactors Employee Central?

  • If you have different information on employee profile and on a position, how can you recognize the correct information?
  • So, You need to sync both to avoid mismatch info. If you are not using sync then you're losing automation as the data from the position.
  • In configuration using position management, only use Position-to-Job Info synchronization direction. I strongly recommend you to use Position to Job info Sync in Manage Position management settings to reduce the User error.

How Synchronization works:

  • Go to "Position Management Settings".
  • Navigate to the "Synchronization Tab".
    • The "Synchronization Tab" determines the behavior of the system when synchronizing data from a Position to an employee’s Job Information. This includes the rules for defining fields used in synchronization of Position to an employee’s Job Information.
  • Configure the fields that should sync
  • Add Business Rules for triggering updates (e.g., when a position is changed, reflect changes in Job Info).

Step-by-Step: Position to JobInfo Sync Configuration with Business Rule:

Define the Use Case:

  • When a change happens in the Job Information Portlet  (like Department, Division, Location), it should automatically reflect in the Position Object.
  • This is handled via a Business Rule using the Scenario: Synchronize Incumbent’s Changes to Position Scenario.

Step: 1 - Create the Business Rule:

  1. Go to Configure Business Rules.

  2. Click Create New Rule.

  3. Choose Position Management  - Pre Delivered Template. 

  4. Under Scenario, select: Synchronize Incumbent’s Changes to Position Scenario.

Step 2 - Register the Rule in Position Management Settings:

  1. Go to Admin Center → Position Management Settings.

  2. Navigate to the Synchronization Tab.

  3. Find the field: "Rule for Synchronizing Job Information to Position".

  4. Assign the Business Rule you just created (JobToPos)

  5. Save the configuration.

Step: 3 Event Reason object configuration

  • Event Reasons act as triggers for synchronization.
  • Common examples:
    • Position Transfer → when an employee moves to a new role.
      • If you are going to change the position then position transfer will be use as follow up activity.
    • Position Reclassification → when department/division updates occur.
      • If you want to change in department and Division then Position Reclassification will be use as follow up activity.
  • These objects ensure accurate, event-driven updates.
  • For the Job info to position Synchronization we need to get help from event reason. On the base of event reason we will get change. Mainly we creates three objects event reason to change happen from Job info to position.

Step: 4 job information portlet and create Business Rule

Prerequisite:

  • First you need to go to Job Information Portlet and check here if we have Event and Event Reason Picklist field is enabled or not.
  • If its enabled and will be visible there then we don’t need to write the business rule for this case user will select manually.
  • If its not enabled then event and event reason will not come up here so we have write the business rule.

Regards,

Mahnoor Naseem

SAP SuccessFactors Consultant

entry.title: Leave Encashment from Annual Leave Quota every year should not go beyond a Capping of 150 days
entry.content:
Namaste Everyone,

In this blog we shall understand a challenge we faced in Time Off - Leave Encashments and how did we arrive at a peculiar solution.

Problem Statement:

The number of days that can be accumulated for a particular Leave Encashment from Annual Leave Quota every year and should not go beyond a Capping of 150 days for the member's service period. This shall be paid to an employee at time of retirement only.

Problem Transformation in SAP/SF Consulting Terms:

An Employee is eligible to take days from Annual Leaves Quota as Leave Encashment every year. When we try to take Leave Encashment until Year 2029, it should allow us to save as Capping is 150.

However, when an employee tries to take Leave Encashment for Year 2030, it should error out and not let an employee save the record. Please refer to below screenshot: 

NOTE: We can take various variations of this encashment: 15 each year would take 10 years to reach capping of 150 days.

Challenges in Standard Approach:

  1. There is no Standard Fit to fetch the data stored in Time Account for Payouts to meet this requirement.
  2. Addition of Payouts from different years.
  3. Rule definition to cater to Payouts from different years.

Solution Proposed:

Leave Encashments leave a trail of Pay Component attached for Leave Encashments within the Compensation – Non-Recurring Portlet. We trickled down this Portlet to:

1.Fetch the number of days of Leave Encashment in a particular year.

2.Pass them on to a field “Placeholder” in a Custom MDF (Encashment) for that year via an Integration Job.

3.From “Placeholder”, it is cumulated via business rule to fill Cumulative Capping in a field “Cumulated Capping”.

Technical Build: 

1. Let us check the Leave Encashment page and try to place Payouts.

 

 

 

2. This should create a Payout linked Pay Component in Non-Recurring Portlet. Let us check that out:

As we can see the Leave Encashment days – 30 are captured here in “Number” field of Pay Component – DEMO_PC_LEAVEENCASH

3. We create an Integration Centre job that shall carry the required data from Non-Recurring Pay Components Portlet to fields in Custom MDF (Annual Encashment)

4. After running IC job, we can see field “Placeholder” carries 30.

Pay Component field carries: DEMO_PC_LEAVEENCASH (as we want values associated only to this Pay Component to be sent to this MDF) 

 

5. But what about field- Cumulated Capping?

We shall create another business rule to carry the “Placeholder” values to “Cumulated Capping.” It will function as a Summation counter adding previous and present values.

6. We shall continue to fill in 30 days till 2029. In Year, 2030- this should give us an error on taking any Leave Encashment days as then it would be greater than capping i.e., 150 days.

 

7. Let us check that in our instance:

We have taken Leave Encashments from YEAR 2025 till 2029. Cumulative Capping thus becomes 150.So, it should error out on YEAR 2030.

ERROR RULE:

Some checks for the YEARs of encashments taken: 

We will run IC job in the backend for every year of Leave Encashment filled. 

As such, MDF also has field- Cumulated Capping = 150.
